tt:div.tt:p:
Or maybe you could swallow your
pride and just apologize to your
super.

So what,
why the frantic phone call?
Malory? Why did you call us?
ARCHER: Because if it was -- oh.

I'm gonna go out on a limb
and assume it had something
to do with that.

like.

ARCHER: Oh, well that's a
relief.

Because it looks like you're
sitting here with a gun.

And over there,

and shot to death,

Or am I misreading the

and head.

I think a catsuit just stops

has recently been fired, is -

the dead guy over there,
who's chock full of bullets!

ARCHER: Yeah, do that,
take that tone.

MALORY: But I swear,
I didn't shoot him!

So I guess he walked in here

obviously panicking,
so you had to restrain him with

these leather cuffs,
and then to keep pressure on

the wounds you greased him up
and squeezed him into this...
And of course not, you ass!

Someone broke in here

unless it was the creepy-old

And wait,
doesn't Italy use a king?

ARCHER: I -- yeah, exactly,

what're you -- don't go
back there, Sterling, I -

Why does this chair have
no seat!
What is in this man's ass? !

MALORY: And you don't have to

ARCHER: Yeah so,

MALORY: Savio and I met after
the war,
when I was in Italy with Gladio.

now I'm done.

It was a NATO stay-behind

set up to counter a possible

of Western Europe.

starring Allen Dulles and a

Anyway,
Savio was in Italian
intelligence -

and we were working all these

late nights,
there was a mutual attraction,
one thing led to another...

MALORY: And then he got married
and went into politics.

But ever since then,
once a year he'd slip away and

we'd spend a romantic weekend
together.

I mean,
if this doesn't just scream
romance...!

What's more romantic than a
dildo-party-slash-murder? !

LANA: A murder I'm trying to get

so could you shut up a second? !

MALORY: And he wasn't always
into that!

As he grew older,
Savio's tastes became more
and more... exotic.

And so he started introducing
all these...

okay! God,
your hands are like cricket
bats.

So Malory, what happened,
can you walk us through the

ARCHER: Just the crime of
murder, not the crime of
sodomy-by-rubber-eggplant.

MALORY: Savio was in town to
give a speech at the UN.

We'd made plans to meet here,
so he gave his handlers the slip
and arrived here at about...

MALORY: We caught up over
a glass or two of champagne.

Then I freshened up while Savio
got changed and...

in his own...
I came out of the bedroom...

MASCALZONE: Si, cara mia,
molto pronto!

MALORY: I crossed over to
the chair,

MALORY: Then I went to
refill my champagne -
Savio loved to be kept waiting -

LANA: Wait, whoa, whoa,
back up -

ARCHER: Why did you have

MALORY: Hm? Oh, well,
Savio liked it to seem a
little...

Jesus, what else
was on tonight's menu? !

Sex under a hive
of Africanized bees? !

ARCHER: Oh, and hit the

because I'm gonna have to...

I'm gonna have to bust you

MALORY: What are you talking

Smash the furniture like he was

fortunately he's Italian so that
shouldn't be too hard a sell,
then --

LANA: On purpose, exactly,
the gun just went off.

ARCHER: But you probably wanna
play that a lot softer with a
jury.

ARCHER: Mother, come on,
I mean I want to believe you...

LANA: But those bullet holes

here.

MALORY: Yes, I know dear,
I was there.

LANA: Well, lemme see,
take off your coat!

MALORY: No! I'm fine,
it's just a through-and-through.

MALORY: What,
I put Bactine on it!

The Italian prime minister was
just assassinated in my
apartment!

And so I think an apology is in
order!

ARCHER: Thanks,
I know that's hard for you.
You two owe me an apology!

ARCHER: How about for you
dragging us into your S&M-
dildo-sex-murder freak show? !

I bet I'll never be able to have
sex again without thinking about
this!

I bet I won't even be able to
eat spaghetti and meatballs!

I mean, not necessarily
spaghetti and meatballs, but...

Not necessarily not spaghetti
and meatballs.

I mean I really like spaghetti
and meatballs.

Man if I don't get some
spaghetti and meatballs,
I may literally die.
LANA: Oh, and thanks so much...

LANA: I meant for dragging me
into this.

We've got a dead Italian prime
minister in the living room,
which --

ARCHER: Sucks, I bet he knew
how to make sauce.

LANA: Which will be hard to
explain.

Especially given the
circumstances leading up to his
death, which were --

LANA: So "plausible deniability"
isn't a super-realistic
goal here.

So we need to sneak the body
out somehow.

ARCHER: Sure,
we'll just walk a dead body
right out the front door!

MALORY: We're not burning down
my apartment!

MALORY: Shut up,
I hit broil instead of bake.

LANA: Well,
blood loss can make you stupid.
Can I please look at your wound?

Nor can you burn down
my apartment,
so think of something else.
ARCHER: I shall fetch a rug!

You're not rolling him up
in one of my rugs!
get some coveralls, and a van.

Like a carpet cleaning van,
and just walk him right out the
front door.

LANA: You just called me
an idiot for that!

ARCHER: Your version didn't have

LANA: Could we go out
through the basement?

We'd have to go past the super's
apartment,
and his door is always open.

I assume to let the stink of
cabbage waft through the halls,
but --

LANA: So? You think he'd be a
problem?

We're not on the best
of terms...

SUPER: It's just, at Christmas,
the tenants usually gimme a

small consideration,
for the work I do all yeer
keepin up the bildin.
We surely count on it, ma'am.

Specially this yeer,
as we had more'n the usual
medical bills.

SUPER: Just that,
fer the tird year runnin...

MALORY: Oh dear,
so once again you're faced with

Do I eat the potato now,
or let it ferment,
so I can drink it later?

TINY LIAM: Will I get
the operation now, Da?

ARCHER: What is your problem
with the Irish?

MALORY: You mean besides not
being on our side
in World War Two?

And now, since I don't
wanna be an accessory

after the fact,
how's about we figure out a way

to get that body out of the damn

ARCHER: Where'd we land on
the coveralls thing?

ARCHER: Because I don't even
know where we'd get coveralls
this time of night, so - -

if we can't get the body out of
here in one piece...
MALORY: Lana, it's the only way.

LANA: No! Malory,
I've done some messed up shit

working for you, but I am not,
repeat not,
chopping up a dead body!

MALORY: What! My God,
do you want me to get the
electric chair? !

For a murder you both know
I didn't commit? !

ARCHER: Whatever,
call it her can't, me won't.

KRIEGER: I need access to a
two-inch drain, hot water,

three GFCI outlets,
this bathroom should do nicely,

and a pot of coffee,
just like I like my women:

Oh, and your sauce needs
less salt.

KRIEGER: Put two halves of a

Oh, and I assume
that's our patient?
ARCHER: Yeah, you got a potato?

ARCHER: He literally might be,
yeah.

MALORY: Well, say what you will
about him --

So no one else will ever know
about this whole -

KRIEGER: Hopefully my greatest
work yet.
CYRIL: No no no no no!

Whatever this is,
I am not getting mixed up in it!

ARCHER: Hey whoa, whoa,
everybody calm down!
It's not what it looks like!

CYRIL: Well, then, what is it,
exactly? !

PAM: 'Cause it sure as shit
ain't a surprise party, Krieger!

LANA: Someone's trying to frame
Malory for murdering the prime
minister of Italy.

CHERYL/CAROL: I bet it's
that wicked king!
Why'd Krieger drag us into it? !

LANA: But it's still pretty
gross though.

When I'm done, each one of us
will walk out the front door
carrying a small parcel...

Then on our way home,
we simply drop the parcels into

seven different trash cans in
three different boroughs.

KRIEGER: And hopefully,
when you look at all the

different drop points on a map,
it'll look like a big

Every single time we come
over here,

we have to help you get rid of

MALORY: Well, you've only
been here twice.

GILLETTE: Speaking of,
why the hell was the prime
minister of Italy here?

PAM: And follow up,
did those dastardly dagoes kill

him and then dress him up like

MALORY: Oh God, that reminds me.

MALORY: Just get it out of here,
please!

MALORY: I'd like to know this
could possibly get any worse.

ARCHER: Well, for one thing,
there's not enough sauce for
everybody.
CYRIL: Jeez it! It's the cops!

ARCHER: And-or the
police could show up.

ARCHER: Cover your arm up,
answer the door, and stall them.

And then somebody get me a
number-ten can of tomatoes.

What, there's already not enough

Sorry, I was in the - - kitchen,
I'm making spaghetti and -

MALORY: Oh, are you Italian,
Officer...?

LT. MURPHY: No,
and it's Detective. Murphy.

But we got an anonymous tip that
Savio Mascalzone was up here.

MALORY: Oooh, who's that,

MALORY: Doesn't Italy use
a king?

anonymous tip said
Mascalzone was dead up here.

LT. MURPHY: Yeah,

MALORY: Well, as you can see,

Although I guess someone must've

I have a few dear friends over

Mind if I talk to them?

MALORY: Heavens, no,
of course not, but -

MALORY: My guests are in here,
Detective, but -

PAM: What are you doing

for the most elegant people in

CYRIL: I hate you all so much.

MALORY: What,
how is this my fault? !

MALORY: Oh,

LANA: And why do you even -

never mind,

it's none of your beeswax.

I hope you won't need it,

By God, if you were my servant,

And Muthah,
the constable wishes a word.

That tip musta been a hoax.

MALORY: No thanks to this one...

It's just,

MALORY: I -- no, of course not.

But I'd recommend

I mean I did what I could,

Sorry again for the intrusion,

And Herlihy,

That snoopy detective is gone,

What about the rest of us?

MALORY: The rest of you can get

But thank you all so much

KRIEGER: And remember,

The bathroom, the body,

I had to make it look good!

ARCHER: Well, and also

Which was full of people,

Blue eyes, full lips,

By a beautiful,

Who may have been

You really wanna know why
